title.narrative: EVIDENCE-BASED POLICY FRAMEWORK AND INTEGRATED PROGRAMMES ENHANCED

description.narrative: Cross-cutting national policy framework and Cross-cutting national policy framework and programmes developed and implemented to address multidimensional poverty of children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Evaluation And Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 the poorest children in Rwanda benefit from a strengthened and adequately-resourced integrated social protection system

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Cross-cutting national policy framework and Cross-cutting national policy framework and programmes developed and implemented to address multidimensional poverty of children.

description.narrative: The Government developed an economic recovery plan to curtail the effects of COVID-19 on the economy and ensure household resilience including reducing the risks of increased multidimensional child poverty. UNICEF supported the generation of socio-economic analysis in a joint assessment produced by the United Nations to strengthen advocacy and resource mobilization. UNICEF also co-led the policy dialogue on Social Protection with Development Partners and the Government of Rwanda and provided technical input throughout the development of the social protection response plan to ensure the needs of children and vulnerable groups were catered for. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020
